title: CS:GO
subtitle: 5 v 5
description:
Counter-Strike: Global Offensive is a tactical first-person shooter developed by Valve Corporation. It is the fourth game in the main Counter-Strike franchise. Like the previous games in the series, Global Offensive is an objective-based multiplayer first-person shooter. Each player joins either the Terrorist or Counter-Terrorist team and attempts to complete objectives or eliminate the enemy team. The game operates in short rounds that end when all players on one side are dead or a teams objective is completed.

# Rules #

## 1. Format: ##

1. Starting with a group phase and then semi-final and final will be single elimination.

2. Both phases will be best of 1.

3. The teams are of size 5.

4. The gamemode is competitive.

5. In case of a draw (15-15), the match will go into overtime until a decisive winner is found (two rounds difference). 

## 2. Maps ##

 - de_dust2

 - de_train

 - de_mirage

 - de_inferno

 - de_nuke

 - de_cache

 - de_overpass

### 2.1 Map pick ###

#### 2.1.1 Best of 1 ####

1. The HOME team will remove 1 map from the map pool. 

2. The AWAY team will remove 2 maps from the remaining 6 maps in the pool.

3. The HOME team will remove 2 maps from the remaining 4 maps in the pool.

4. The AWAY team will select the map to be played from the remaining 2 maps in the pool.

5. The HOME team will select their side (counter-terrorists or terrorists).

#### 2.1.2 Best of 3 ####

1. The AWAY team will remove 2 maps from the map pool. After this, the HOME team will choose one of the remaining 5 maps as the first map in the series.

2. The HOME team will remove 2 maps from the remaining 4 maps in the pool. Next, the AWAY team will choose one of 2 maps remaining in the pool as the second map in the series.

3. The remaining map in the pool will serve as the tiebreaker map (if necessary).

4. The maps will be played in order.

## 3. Game and Server settings ##

 - MR15

This means that you'll play 15 rounds on each side. In case of a draw, overtime rules apply.

### 3.1 Server/client settings ###

We're using the ESL server config:

Two flashes and a maximum of two other grenades are allowed.

Forbidden:

weapon_recoil_model 0

mat_hdr_level 0/1/2

Always use:

weapon_debug_spread_show 0

### 3.2 Bugs and forbidden actions ###

1. Using bugs isn't allowed.  

Boosting through walls, ceiling and ground, skywalking, map swimming, floating and sharking are all forbidden.

2. Scripts are not allowed, except buy scripts. 

## 4. Technical Issues ##

1. If either player disconnects from the game due to technical reasons and the game is heavily favoured towards the other party, an administrator may rule the game in favour of said player, provided a screenshot of the game prior or just at the moment of the disconnect. Should the game be too close to call, it will be replayed.
2. If a player uses an alternative connection than ethernet they do so at their own risk and can’t be guaranteed the same stability as other players.

## 5. Behaviour and Conduct ##

1. If a participant commits - or threatens to commit - violent acts against any other player in the Tournament, any admin, or any spectators of the Tournament, they may be disqualified from the Tournament.
2. If a participant behaves in any unsportsmanlike way it is possible that they receive a penalty, to the sole discretion of the administrators.
3. It is a players responsibility to be on time for their matches, if they are late they will suffer a penalty. This can be either losing a game after 20 minutes, or the entire match after 30 minutes so as to not delay the entire tournament. A player is required to inform the tournament staff if they are late for a match, including a valid reason. If not they will be dropped from the tournament.
4. One 5 minute break is allowed between a match.
5. Coaching is not allowed during a match.

## 6. Tournament Eligibility ##

1. Participants which have a conflict of interest may be excluded from tournaments.
2. The current organising committee (LANcie) have the final say in tournament eligibility

## 7. Penalties ##

Depending on the situation a player could be penalised in any of the following ways:

1. Score penalization (eg. starting their next match 0-1 instead of 0-0)
2. Penalised for one match (eg. forfeiting a match)
3. Disqualification from the tournament entirely

## 8. Drop out ##

If a player decides to drop out of the tournament they are required to contact the administrators and sign a drop out sheet for confirmation. Once a player has dropped out of the tournament they will not be able to rejoin.

title: SMASH BROS
subtitle: FFA
